ethereum.name: Ethereum Mainnet
ethereum.description: Ethereum, proposed by Vitalik Buterin in 2013 and launched in 2015, is the most decentralized smart contract to date and aiming to scale via Layer 2s.

logo.body: <svg width="15" height="15" viewBox="0 0 15 15" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="7.5" cy="7.5" r="7.5" fill="currentColor"/></svg>

arbitrum.name: Arbitrum One
arbitrum.description: Arbitrum One is developed by Offchain Labs. It uses an optimistic rollup approach and is fully EVM compatible, making it developer-friendly.

arbitrum_nova.name: Arbitrum Nova
arbitrum_nova.description: Arbitrum Nova is an Optimium developed by Offchain using AnyTrust protocol. As part of the Nitro stack Arbitrum Nova is fully EVM compatible.

base.name: Base Chain
base.description: Base is an Ethereum Layer 2 offering a secure, low-cost, builder-friendly way for anyone, anywhere, to build onchain.

blast.name: Blast
blast.description: Blast is an EVM-compatible Optimistic Rollup which invests bridged funds in order to offer native yield to its users.

celo.name: Celo
celo.description: Mobile-first. Celo has the mission to build a regenerative digital economy that fosters prosperity for all. It migrated from being an L1 to an L2 in 2025.

derive.name: Derive
derive.description: Derive (former Lyra) is built using the OP Stack specially for Derive protocol - a settlement protocol for spot, perpetuals, and options trading.

fraxtal.name: Fraxtal
fraxtal.description: Fraxtal is an EVM equivalent Optimium utilizing the OP stack.

gravity.name: Gravity
gravity.description: Gravity is an Optimium built on the Orbit stack. It has its own gas token - G. A future migration to an L1 of the same name is planned.

imx.name: Immutable X
imx.description: Immutable X is a game-specific (not EVM compatible) zk rollup for minting, transferring, and trading tokens/NFTs at high volumes with zero gas fees.

ink.name: Ink
ink.description: Ink is an Ethereum OP Stack layer 2 blockchain designed to be the house of DeFi for the Superchain.

linea.name: Linea
linea.description: Linea is a developer-friendly ZK Rollup by ConsenSys, enhancing Ethereum by enabling a new wave of decentralized applications.

lisk.name: Lisk
lisk.description: Lisk is developed by the Onchain Foundation. It runs on the OP Stack as an EVM‑equivalent Layer 2 with low‑cost, scalable transactions for builders.

loopring.name: Loopring
loopring.description: Loopring is a zk Rollup exchange and payment protocol. It is arguably the oldest rollup with its mainnet launch in December 2019.

manta.name: Manta Pacific
manta.description: Manta Pacific is an Optimium empowering EVM-native zero-knowledge (ZK) applications and general dapps.

mantle.name: Mantle
mantle.description: Mantle is an OVM based EVM-compatible rollup. Public launch was in July 2023.

metis.name: Metis
metis.description: Metis Andromeda is an EVM equivalent Optimium. Public launch was in November 2021.

mint.name: Mint
mint.description: Mints mission is to connect global consumers with NFTs and creating a decentralized payment network.

mode.name: Mode Network
mode.description: Mode is an Optimistic Rollup and part of the Superchain.

logo.body: <svg width="15" height="15" viewBox="0 0 15 15" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="7.5" cy="7.5" r="7.5" fill="currentColor"/></svg>

optimism.name: OP Mainnet
optimism.description: OP Mainnet uses an optimistic rollup approach and is one of the oldest rollups. It is fully EVM compatible and it's tech-stack is widely used.

orderly.name: Orderly
orderly.description: Orderly is an OP stack Optimium on Ethereum using Celestia for data availability. It has a unified ledger for assets from multiple chains and an orderbook that can be used by apps.

polygon_zkevm.name: Polygon zkEVM
polygon_zkevm.description: Polygon zkEVM uses zero-knowledge proofs to run EVM-compatible smart contracts, simplifying migration for developers to the Polygon network.

redstone.name: Redstone
redstone.description: Redstone is a chain built from the ground up for onchain games and autonomous worlds

scroll.name: Scroll
scroll.description: Scroll is a general purpose zkEVM rollup. Public launch was in October 2023.

soneium.name: Soneium
soneium.description: We dream of an open internet that transcends cultural differences and brings together people with diverse values.

starknet.name: Starknet
starknet.description: Starknet is a ZK Rollup developed by Starkware. It uses it's own programming language and general purpose virtual machine (Cairo VM).

swell.name: Swellchain
swell.description: Swellchain operates as a restaking-focused L2 built on the OP Stack. It aims to extend ETH security through EigenLayer restaking while using OP infra

taiko.name: Taiko Alethia
taiko.description: Taiko Alethia is a based, general purpose type-1 zk-rollup built to scale Ethereum without compromising decentralization.

unichain.name: Unichain
unichain.description: A Layer 2 sepcifically designed to be the home for DeFi and the home for multichain liquidity.

worldchain.name: World Chain
worldchain.description: World Chain is an OP Stack Rollup built to scale Proof of Personhood, aiming to offer priority blockspace for users with a World ID.

zksync_era.name: ZKsync Era
zksync_era.description: ZKsync Era uses ZK tech, aiming to boost throughput while preserving Ethereum's core values: freedom, self-sovereignty, and decentralization.

zora.name: Zora
zora.description: Zora is a fully EVM compatible optimistic rollup built on the OP Stack with focus on NFTs.

10_foundational.name: Foundational
10_foundational.description: Ethereum Mainnet, a fully decentralized and secure network that anchors the entire ecosystem.

4_robust.name: Robust
4_robust.description: Fully decentralized and secure network that cannot be tampered with or stopped by any individual or group, including its creators. This is a network that fulfills Ethereum's vision of decentralization.

3_maturing.name: Maturing
3_maturing.description: A network transitioning to being decentralized. A group of actors still may be able to halt the network in extreme situations.

2_developing.name: Developing
2_developing.description: A centralized operator runs the network but adds fail-safe features to reduce risks of centralization.

1_emerging.name: Emerging
1_emerging.description: A centralized operator runs the network. The data is publicly visible on Ethereum to verify whether the operator is being honest.

0_early_phase.name: Not Categorized
0_early_phase.description: A project that just recently launched or that doesn't currently fall into any of the other categories.

only_l1.name: Ethereum Mainnet
only_l1.description: Only users that interacted with Ethereum Mainnet but not with any L2.

cross_layer.name: Cross-Layer
cross_layer.description: Users that interacted with Ethereum Mainnet and at least one L2.

multiple_l2s.name: Multiple Layer 2s
multiple_l2s.description: Users that interacted with multiple L2s but not Ethereum Mainnet.

single_l2.name: Single Layer 2
single_l2.description: Users that interacted with a single L2 but not Ethereum Mainnet.

all_l2s.name: All Layer 2s
all_l2s.description: Users that interacted with all L2s.

ethereum_events.title: Genesis Block
ethereum_events.description: The Ethereum genesis block was mined. The start of the network.

ethereum_events.title: Homestead Upgrade
ethereum_events.description: The Homestead upgrade lead to a slight reduction in block times.

ethereum_events.title: Anomaly
ethereum_events.description: A series of Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks targeted the Ethereum network which led to a temporary increase in block time.

ethereum_events.title: Difficulty Bomb Activates
ethereum_events.description: Difficulty bomb activates slowing block times.

ethereum_events.title: Byzantium - Reduce Issuance and Difficulty Bomb Delay
ethereum_events.description: Byzantium upgrade includes a reduction of block rewards from 5 ETH to 3 ETH and delays difficulty bomb.

ethereum_events.title: Difficulty Bomb Activates
ethereum_events.description: Difficulty bomb reactivates slowing block times.

ethereum_events.title: Constantinople - Reduce Issuance and Difficulty Bomb Delay
ethereum_events.description: Constantinople upgrade reduces block reward from 3 ETH to 2 ETH and delays difficulty bomb.

ethereum_events.title: Difficulty Bomb Activates
ethereum_events.description: Difficulty bomb reactivates slowing block times.

ethereum_events.title: Difficulty Bomb Activates
ethereum_events.description: Muir Glacier upgrade delayed difficulty bomb.

ethereum_events.title: Serenity Phase 0
ethereum_events.description: Serenity Phase 0 deployment increased issuance to secure the Beacon Chain a separate Proof-of-Stake network running in parallel to Ethereum's Proof-of-Work (PoW)

ethereum_events.title: London Burn EIP-1559
ethereum_events.issuance: 2 ETH per Block + PoS issuance + Fee Burn
ethereum_events.description: London upgrade introduced EIP-1559 a mechanism to burn a portion of transaction fees. Ultra sound money is born.

ethereum_events.title: Paris The Merge
ethereum_events.description: Paris upgrade introduced the Merge - a transition from PoW to PoS by merging the main Ethereum chain with the Beacon Chain. This event permanently reduced ETH issuance by approximately 90%.

ethereum_events.title: Shanghai-Capella (Shapella)
ethereum_events.description: Shapella introduces various Staking improvements like enabling withdrawals.

ethereum_events.title: Prague-Electra (Pectra)
ethereum_events.description: Pectra increases Blob Target and brings UX improvements with native Account Abstraction

ethereum_events.title: Fulu-Osaka (Fusaka)
ethereum_events.description: Fusaka bundles a set of EIPs aimed at dramatically scaling Blobs and boosting overall throughput by raising the gas limit.
